alert.note: Alert for Curry; Quay; Roosevelt (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 27 at 8:13PM MDT until May 27 at 11:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Curry County in east central New Mexico... Southern Quay County in east central New Mexico... Northwestern Roosevelt County in east central New Mexico... * Until 1115 PM MDT. * At 813 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Clovis, Quay, San Jon, Grady, House, Wheatland, Ragland, Broadview, Ranchvale, Bellview, Forrest, Mcalister, Bard and Pleasant Hill. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 343 and 373. Locations where the ground is saturated over the past few days will be especially susceptible to flash flooding this evening. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
